snippet: The protests, some at the alma maters of the court’s members, might sway the justices in a University of Texas case where a white woman was denied entrance.
abstract: Supreme Court's weighing of case brought by Abigail Fisher, white woman who claims she was rejected from University of Texas due to school's unconstitutional accommodation of black applicants, will likely be influenced by racial protests sweeping nation's campuses; court's past rejection of affirmative action as means of righting past wrongs conflicts with protester demands for examination of racism on campuses and in United States.
lead_paragraph: The protests, some at the alma maters of the court’s members, might sway the justices in a University of Texas case where a white woman was denied entrance.

headline.main: Students’ Protests May Play Role in Supreme Court Case on Race in Admissions
headline.print_headline: College Protests Could Influence Key Racial Case
